channel.title: Jamie Maher
channel.description: I am a Computer Science major at the University of Notre Dame

item.title: MATLAB
item.description: In a team of four members, I created a navigation program for students at the University of Notre Dame. The user could pick a starting and ending location, and the program would use a geodesic path-finding algorithm and image processing to find the shortest sidewalk path between those two points. The path was then illustrated on the map for the user to see.

item.title: HTML and Web Development
item.description: For research, I updated the design of a speech collection website. I used HTML, CSS, and some JavaScript.

item.title: C
item.description: I created a fully-functional game of Minesweeper using the GFX graphics library.

item.title: Python
item.description: I used python to create a password cracker for an assignment. It went through hashes and decoded them. Since there were thousands of combinations, I also used a host of computers to give the jobs to.

item.title: C++
item.description: I created a Mario-style side scrolling video game using C++ and the SDL graphics library. I worked in a group with three other members. The final game had detailed graphics, sound, responsive gameplay, and a high score tracker.

item.title: Recursion
item.description: This project used recursion to create images of fractals.
